metadata.synopsis: Astarion-avatar gets attacked by a group of vampire spawns during a long rest
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As Avataroe debugbookdowngrade the other avatar to companionAstarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Vampire AmbushTake a long rest

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Rest does not come easy tonight. Your mind considers one future after another, teasing apart the possibilities.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Should you face Cazador? Should you run? And what of his ritual - this 'Ascension' - how can you turn that to your advantage?*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *You're weighing up your prospects when a faint noise jerks you alert. There's someone in the dark...*

68.speaker: Leon
68.context: NodeContext: He was creeping up on a resting Astarion, but Astarion woke up and spotted him.

11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion gets to his feet quickly, expecting a fight

64.speaker: Aurelia
64.text: Peace, brother. We're just here to take you home.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: And if I refuse to come?

40.speaker: Leon
40.text: Refuse? But 'thou shalt obey me in all things'.
40.context: NodeContext: Quoting one of his master Cazador's rules

61.speaker: Aurelia
61.text: It seems Petras was right - the rules no longer apply to our dear brother.

66.speaker: Leon
66.text: Don't matter. The master needs all seven of us for the ritual.

24.speaker: Leon
24.text: The master said bring you home - so you're coming home.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: I can beat Cazador. Follow me, help me complete the ritual, and I'll set you free.

62.speaker: Leon
62.text: You do look different - stronger, fire in your eyes.

14.speaker: Leon
14.text: Maybe you could take Cazador's place. Maybe you could free us.

28.speaker: Aurelia
28.text: Easy to say, but we can't disobey the master. We're not as lucky as you, Astarion.

53.speaker: Leon
53.text: Follow you? The runt of the kennel? Master's favourite toy?

19.speaker: Aurelia
19.text: You want us to throw away our chance at freedom? On your word that you can defeat the master? Be serious.

57.speaker: Leon
57.text: You were always weak, brother. We don't follow weak.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: What if we joined together? Fought Cazador together?

16.speaker: Leon
16.text: Fight him? You know we can't.

13.speaker: Leon
13.text: Together? Since when do you care 'bout anyone but yourself?

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: What ritual? What are you talking about?

45.speaker: Aurelia
45.text: You don't know? The Rite of Profane Ascension.

44.speaker: Leon
44.text: The master's holding a Black Mass. That's where he'll ascend, and we'll get to live again.

2.speaker: Aurelia
2.text: The scars he carved into our backs bind us to the ritual. Seven spawn, seven sigils.

48.speaker: Leon
48.text: And you're number seven - the final piece of the Rite. He needs us all for the Black Mass.

72.speaker: Aurelia
72.text: We'll walk in the sun. We'll finally be free, brother.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: Listen to me, this ritual of Cazador's - we're part of it. He's going to sacrifice us all!

15.speaker: Aurelia
15.text: Of course not, the master needs us. We're loyal. And more to the point, we're useful.

5.speaker: Leon
5.text: But if brother's right, we're more useful to him dead.

70.speaker: Aurelia
70.text: Then we'll die! Unlike our sweet brother, we've no choice but to obey.

59.speaker: Leon
59.text: Master said bring him home. Master said to fight... Never forbade us from talking, though.

22.speaker: Leon
22.text: Sorry, brother. This is the best we can do.

20.speaker: Aurelia
20.text: Of course not, the master's no fool. He needs us.

6.speaker: Aurelia
6.text: And he needs you, Astarion. It's time to come home.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: I'm not going anywhere with you.

17.speaker: Aurelia
17.text: You're not listening, brother. You have to come with us.

55.speaker: Aurelia
55.text: When the master ascends, he'll take us with him. We'll all be free.

60.speaker: Leon
60.text: We'll walk in the sun. We won't feel hungry all the time. We'll be living vampires.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: It's a lie - Cazador would never share power with us.

25.speaker: Aurelia
25.text: You may be free of his rules, but we're not.

32.speaker: Leon
32.text: Not with you, maybe. Not with the runt of the kennel.

47.speaker: Aurelia
47.text: We've listened to you for long enough, brother. We have our commands.

56.speaker: Leon
56.text: The master told us to take you alive. 'As broken as possible, but alive.'

1.speaker: Aurelia
1.text: The master said you might offer to come willing, but his orders were very specific.

9.speaker: Aurelia
9.text: Still picking fights you can't win? You always were pig-headed, brother.

71.speaker: Aurelia
71.text: Looks like the rules no longer apply to our dear brother. Curious.
